description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the kernel streaming wow thunk service driver elevation of privilege vulnerability:

1. Ensure your system runs a supported version of Windows 10 or Windows 11.
2. Download and install the appropriate KB update from the links below:
   - For Windows 11 Version 24H2: [KB5043080](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043080)
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2: [KB5043076](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043076)
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2 (x64): [KB5043064](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043064)
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2 (x64): [KB5043067](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043067)
3. Restart your system after installation to ensure the updates take effect.

**Details**:
- This update addresses the heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the kernel streaming service, which could allow an elevation of privilege. 
- Ensure all system backups are completed before proceeding with updates to avoid any data loss.
